1456631073396432896.text: Finally, it requires the Secretary of Transportation to commission a report by the National Academies on the operations, safety, and efficiency of trains longer than 7,500 feet and submit this report to relevant Congressional committees within two years.

1456631072322736136.text: The bill also creates a Blocked Crossing Portal & requires the Federal Railroad Administration to collect information on blocked crossings. It requires all railroads to provide contact info on a public website so that the public can report safety issues directly to the railroad.

1456631071169302534.text: The Bipartisan Infrastructure bill will create a Railroad Crossing Elimination Grant Program and authorize $500 million per year to eliminate unnecessary railroad crossings.

1456631070091358209.text: My team and I are working toward finding long-term solutions to these blockages at the federal level. I was proud to advocate for & support several provisions in the Bipartisan Infrastructure bill—which I strongly support—to address this longstanding issue. More👇🏾

1367151180812582914.text: During that time, a number of the President’s cabinet secretaries walked through the room. And I remember, one after the other they would come up to Ms. Amelia and thank her for all that she sacrificed in her fight for our right to vote. https://t.co/TLZN3rmdsX

1356723616713498625.text: This week serves as a reminder that our nation’s gun violence epidemic affects us ALL, and we must #DoSomething to protect and support our communities.

1356723615870431234.text: That’s why I am supporting the Resources for Victims of Gun Violence Act, led by my colleague @RepDwightEvans, to comprehensively address the physical and emotional toll suffered by those impacted by gun violence—especially for our must undeserved communities.

1356723614993813504.text: Another staunch reality is that America is becoming a nation of gun violence survivors with little to no resources to cope with their trauma. Congress must do more to ensure these victims have access to the resources they need to recover!

1356723613894930434.text:
This statistic is even greater for Black Americans, who disproportionately represent the majority of gun homicide victims. Take the story of Sheldon King, the late brother of my office's @CBCFInc fellow, Danielle King, who was murdered at the age of 33. 

https://t.co/oK7znLalOd

1356723612930179075.text: During #NationalGunViolenceSurvivorsWeek, we are confronted with this disturbing truth: According to @Everytown, 58% of American adults are survivors of gun violence, either experiencing gun violence themselves or caring for someone who has.

1356624015373332480.text: Today in #BlackHistoryMonth, I'm recognizing Civil Rights Pioneer Claudette Colvin. When Claudette was just 15, she was arrested for not giving up her seat to a white woman. What many people don’t know is that Claudette was arrested for this offense 9 months before Rosa Parks! https://t.co/omRcBRqQLD

1356622753051389955.text:

1356251930360754183.text: I hope that our nation – and our leaders – will unite behind the cause most dear to John: voting rights. 1356251925717651460.text: As he always said, he gave a little blood on Selma bridge, but he also bridged the gaps that so often divide our political parties, working every day for a more just America. While John has left this earth, his legacy fighting for equality and justice lives on.

1356251919820484609.text: Today, that’s Alabama’s native son, Congressman John Robert Lewis. Growing up as a little girl in Selma, Alabama, John’s incredible legacy was a hero’s tale as familiar to me as any Bible story or family lore. https://t.co/zm1zNxZtr0

1310367012900741128.text: Read my full statement on President Trump’s nomination of Judge Amy Coney Barrett to the United States Supreme Court here: https://t.co/E5DzYO7HXv https://t.co/iwQgmOvLfA

1310005360565026817.text: Fairness and comity demand that the Senate not confirm any vacancy on the Supreme Court until the American people have chosen the next president. To do otherwise, I believe would undermine the very legitimacy of the Supreme Court.

1310005358392471552.text: This blatant power grab by Trump and Senate Republicans is especially disturbing given that the voting process has already begun with hundreds of thousands of voters having cast their ballots in the 2020 presidential election.

1310005357096374279.text: This standard articulated by Senate Republicans was applied against President Obama’s nomination of Judge Merrick Garland eight months before the 2016 presidential election.

1310005355712262149.text: The nomination of Judge Amy Coney Barrett is clearly tainted by the hypocrisy of Senate Republicans to go back on their own promise not to fill a vacancy on the Supreme Court so close to a presidential election.

1310005354210754561.text: The Supreme Court nomination by President Trump today, with the 2020 presidential election only 38 days away, denies the American people a voice in this very important decision.
